image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Michigan; born in Cleveland, Cuyahoga County, Ohio, September 12, 1941; graduated from St. Ignatius High School, Cleveland, Ohio, 1959; A.B., Wayne State University, Detroit, Mich., 1965; J.D., University of Michigan Law School, Ann Arbor, Mich., 1967; admitted to the Michigan Bar in 1968; lawyer, private practice; member of the Michigan state house of representatives, 1970; reelected in 1972; delegate to Michigan state Democratic conventions, 1968-1974; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-fourth and to the three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1975-January 3, 1983); was not a candidate for reelection to the Ninety-eighth Congress in 1982; resumed the practice of law; is a resident of West Bloomfield, Mich..

researchRecord.name: 1970-1982, 147 boxes and 1 audio tape.
researchRecord.description: Correspondence, public testimony, audio tape, press releases, political campaign files, and other materials, relating to William Brodhead's political career in the Michigan and U.S. House of Representatives. Topics include loan guarantee for Chrysler Corporation and tax policies. A finding aid is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: 1994, 2 commercials on 1 videocassette.
researchRecord.description: Commercials used during William Brodhead's 1994 campaign for U. S. Senate in Michigan, Democratic Party.
